title: Exodus Movie Poster Font
content:
Hello,

I'm looking to see if anyone knows the name of the font that was created for the movie Exodus. An example is attached.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Exodus-Gods-and-Kings-Poster-Bale-and-Edgerton copy.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/typophile.com/files/Exodus-Gods-and-Kings-Poster-Bale-and-Edgerton%20copy_0.jpg) | 15.47 KB |
author: ckozak12

comments.content:
Right Bob, close to Blair but that's not it. Some differences: /E with equal width bars, circular /O, /S leaning towards. [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/engravers+gothic) has a better /O but the rest looks off as well... Don't know what it is for the moment.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Exodus_GoogleP_CoverBG_3800.jpg)

I knew I've already seen this one... About 'Gladiator' this time, another Ridley Scott's movie: [http://www.typophile.com/node/117569](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.typophile.com/node/117569 "http://www.typophile.com/node/117569")

> Can't find a match for the complete lettering. You're right, that could be a mash-up. /C, /O and /G look very " [Avant-Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic) and the rest close to [Aviano Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/aviano-sans), [Idlewid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/idlewild/overview) or [Syncopate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Syncopate). Still searching...

Adding [Luxury](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/luxuryfonts) Gold, [Halogen](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/halogen) and [Capline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041215/http:/typography.net/fontfamilies/view/42) to the list. 'DECEMBER' BTW is Aviano Sans.
Good Additions Ryuk, I only floated Blair because it has been around for a number of years.
